org.droitateddb

Class DbCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • org.droitateddb.DbCreator

  • public class DbCreator
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    Handles db creation and updates.
    Author:
    Falk Appel, Alexander Frank

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static DbCreator getInstance(android.content.Context context)

      • getDatabaseConnection

        public android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase getDatabaseConnection()
        Gives you a database connection you can access the database with.
        Don't forget to call reduceDatabaseConnection when you are done with the connection.
        Returns:
        Connection to the local SQLite database

      • reduceDatabaseConnection

        public void reduceDatabaseConnection()
        Reduce the connection opened. This should always be called after calling getDatabaseConnection and only after that.

      • functionOnDatabase

        public <T> T functionOnDatabase(DbFunction<T> dbFunction)
        Execute a function on the database, to return some values. The opening and closing of the database connection is handled for you.
        Note if you want to query a cursor from the database consider using the DbCreator#query or DbCreator#rawQuery method.
        This can be useful when working with CursorAdapter
        Type Parameters:
        T - Resulting type
        Parameters:
        dbFunction - Function you want to execute on the database
        Returns:
        The result of the function call

      • consumeDatabase

        public void consumeDatabase(DbConsumer dbConsumer)
        Execute an action on the database. The opening and closing of the database connection is handled for you.
        Parameters:
        dbConsumer - Action you want to execute on the database

      • query

        public android.database.Cursor query(java.lang.String table,
                                     java.lang.String[] columns,
                                     java.lang.String selection,
                                     java.lang.String[] selectionArgs,
                                     java.lang.String groupBy,
                                     java.lang.String having,
                                     java.lang.String orderBy)
        Executes a query on the database. Note that when calling close on the returned cursor the database connection count is reduces as well.
        Parameters:
        table - Name of the table
        columns - Used columns of the queried table
        selection - Selection statement
        selectionArgs - Selection arguments
        groupBy - SQL group by
        having - SQL having
        orderBy - SQL order by
        Returns:
        A Cursor containing the result, which reduces the database connection count when closed

      • rawQuery

        public android.database.Cursor rawQuery(java.lang.String sql)
        Executes a raw query on the database. Note that when calling close on the returned cursor the database connection count is reduces as well.
        Parameters:
        sql - Raw SQL statement
        Returns:
        A Cursor containing the result, which reduces the database connection count when closed

      • getReadableDatabase

        @Deprecated
public android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase getReadableDatabase()
        Deprecated. Don't use this method any more. Use getDatabaseConnection.
        This method is not supported with this helper. You have to use getDatabaseConnection and reduceDatabaseConnection
        Overrides:
        getReadableDatabase in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Use the getDatabaseConnection method and the reduceDatabaseConnection method to access the SQLiteDatabase

      • getWritableDatabase

        @Deprecated
public android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase getWritableDatabase()
        Deprecated. Don't use this method any more. Use getDatabaseConnection.
        This method is not supported with this helper. You have to use getDatabaseConnection and reduceDatabaseConnection
        Overrides:
        getWritableDatabase in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Use the getDatabaseConnection method and the reduceDatabaseConnection method to access the SQLiteDatabase
